title: Magnon squeezing via reservoir-engineered optomagnomechanics
authors: Zhi-Yuan Fan, Huai-Bing Zhu, Hao-Tian Li, Jie Li
abstract:
We show how to prepare magnonic squeezed states in an optomagnomechanical
system, in which magnetostriction induced mechanical displacement couples to an
optical cavity via radiation pressure. We discuss two scenarios depending on
whether the magnomechanical coupling is linear or dispersive. We show that in
both cases the strong mechanical squeezing obtained via two-tone driving of the
optical cavity can be efficiently transferred to the magnon mode. In the linear
coupling case, stationary magnon squeezing is achieved; while in the dispersive
coupling case, a transient magnonic squeezed state is prepared in a two-step
protocol. The proposed magnonic squeezed states find promising applications in
quantum information processing and quantum sensing using magnons.
